title: 'Hounded by govt for last 10 yrs': Rahul backs Vadra; calls ED chargesheet 'witch hunt'
content: Rahul Gandhi has strongly defended Robert Vadra against money laundering charges, dismissing the ED's chargesheet as a decade-long politically motivated witch hunt. The ED accuses Vadra of laundering proceeds from a Gurgaon land deal, leading to the attachment of his properties. Vadra's office has refuted the charges, asserting his cooperation and confidence in clearing his name through legal proceedings.

title: ‘Krishna Dhaba Biryani Express’: Dhaba owner in MP forced to do sit ups over title
content: In Chhatarpur, Madhya Pradesh, a dhaba owner faced humiliation. He was forced to do sit-ups by a group. His eatery, named after a Hindu deity, served non-vegetarian food. Activists from Hindu Jodo Sangathan confronted Gyanchand Chaurasia. They demanded he change the name of Krishna Dhaba Biryani Express. Police have registered a case against three individuals and are investigating the matter.

title: Maharashtra assembly brawl: 2 arrested after BJP-NCP (SP) supporters indulge in fist fight
content: Following a heated argument, supporters of BJP MLA Gopichand Padalkar and NCP leader Jitendra Awhad clashed outside the Maharashtra Assembly, leading to the registration of an FIR and two arrests. A video of the scuffle inside the Vidhan Bhavan, near the main staircase and lobby, went viral, showing both groups exchanging blows.

title: Harassed by in-laws, UP woman writes note on hands, legs & kills herself
content: Manisha, a 28-year-old woman, died in Baghpat. She consumed poison. Her family alleges dowry harassment by her husband Kundan Kumar and in-laws. Manisha left a suicide note on her body. It accused her husband and in-laws. The couple married in November 2023. Baghpat police are investigating the case as a dowry death. The investigation is underway.

title: Elon Musk’s reaction to Astronomer CEO's apology after Coldplay ‘kiss cam’ scandal
content: A video of Astronomer CEO Andy Byron and HR head Kristin Cabot kissing at a Coldplay concert has gone viral, sparking online chatter dubbed "Coldplaygate." The incident, captured on a kiss cam, led to speculation about workplace relationships. Elon Musk reacted to a morphed apology tweet with a laughing emoji, further fueling the controversy.

title: IND vs ENG: Shastri delivers damning verdict on Pant - 'He shouldn't play if ...'
content: As Team India prepares for a crucial Test against England, Rishabh Pant's injured finger is a major concern. Ravi Shastri insists Pant should only play if fit to keep wickets, while assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate remains optimistic about his recovery. Pant's participation hinges on his ability to both bat and keep effectively, with Dhruv Jurel as a potential replacement.

title: No relief for Lalu Yadav in 'land-for-jobs' case: SC refuses to stay plea
content: The Supreme Court has refused to halt trial court proceedings against Lalu Prasad Yadav in the CBI's land-for-jobs case. Yadav's appeal followed the Delhi High Court's refusal to stay proceedings and issuance of notice to the CBI.

title: ‘No legal basis’: US says India has no grounds for retaliatory tariffs
content: The US has informed the WTO that India's retaliatory tariffs on American automobiles, steel, and aluminium lack a legal basis, despite India's claim of significant export impact and duty collections. This dispute unfolds as both nations engage in trade deal negotiations, with the US asserting its tariffs are protected under national security provisions.

title: Perplexity Pro is free for Airtel users: How to claim Rs 17,000 free access
content: Airtel has partnered with Perplexity, an AI company, to offer its subscribers a free 12-month subscription to Perplexity Pro, typically priced at Rs 17,000 annually. This offer extends to Airtel's prepaid, postpaid, Wi-Fi, and DTH customers, granting access to Perplexity's AI-powered search and answer engine.

title: Cricket | 'Someone like Tendulkar ...': When Ponting knew Starc was special
content: Mitchell Starc celebrated his 100th Test with a remarkable 6 for 9 against the West Indies, prompting Ricky Ponting to recall the moment he recognised Starc's potential. Ponting remembers a young Starc troubling Sachin Tendulkar with pace and bounce, signaling his extraordinary talent. Starc's commitment to prioritising Test cricket over IPL has solidified his legacy as an Australian great.

title: Speeding cop’s son mows down engineer, woman in Gujarat
content: In Bhavnagar's Kaliyabeed area, a tragic accident claimed the lives of Bhargav Bhatt, a 30-year-old engineer, and Champa Vachhani, 62, after being struck by a speeding car. Harshrajsinh Gohil, the driver and son of a local policeman, was arrested. The incident, captured on CCTV, shows the car veering off course and hitting the victims.

title: MP college brands chicken breed 'Narmada', sparks row
content: A private college in Harda faced backlash for advertising chickens, listing one breed as 'Narmada,' a name sacred to the Narmadiya Brahmin Samaj. The community protested, deeming it an insult to their religious beliefs and the revered Narmada River.

title: Why Google staff think AI chief Demis Hassabis may succeed Sundar Pichai
content: Demis Hassabis, Google DeepMind's CEO, is being viewed by some within Google as a possible successor to Sundar Pichai. Similar to Pichai's rise, Hassabis' increasing influence, especially in AI, fuels this speculation. While some believe his passion for research might deter him, his leadership of Google's AI initiatives positions him as a strong candidate.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Got to look at all factors' - India may be forced to play Bumrah in Manchester
content: India face bowling concerns as Arshdeep Singh's hand injury adds to Bumrah's workload management issues ahead of the crucial Manchester Test. The team management is considering playing Bumrah, despite his limited availability, while assessing Rishabh Pant's fitness to keep wickets. Mohammed Siraj's role becomes vital, and the team must carefully manage his workload to ensure he remains effective.

title: Message to Pak: India tests nuclear-capable Agni-1 & Prithvi-2 ballistic missiles
content: India has test-fired its nuclear-capable Prithvi-2 and Agni-1 ballistic missiles, sending a strategic message to Pakistan following recent border tensions. The tests, conducted by the strategic forces command, validated the operational and technical parameters of these Pakistan-specific missiles. These routine trials occur as India enhances its nuclear deterrence capabilities, with plans to induct the advanced Agni-Prime missile.

title: Cash row: Ahead of removal motion in Parliament, Justice Varma moves Supreme Court
content: Justice Yashwant Varma of Allahabad High Court has petitioned the Supreme Court, contesting an inquiry report and a recommendation for impeachment proceedings against him. He claims the inquiry committee denied him a fair chance to respond before issuing its findings. The plea precedes Parliament's monsoon session, starting July 21.

title: Sports Business: BCCI posts revenue of Rs 9,741.7 cr in FY 2023-24; IPL contributes 59 percent
content: The BCCI has announced record revenue of Rs 9,741.7 crore for FY 23-24, fuelled primarily by the IPL, which contributed 59% of total earnings. The IPL's success provides opportunities for players and ensures profitability, while the BCCI explores commercialising traditional formats and leveraging its substantial reserves. International cricket boards are also seeking collaboration, highlighting the BCCI's significant influence.

title: Bengaluru bomb scare: 40 private schools receive threat mails; alert sounded
content: Bengaluru was thrown into a state of alarm on Friday morning as approximately 40 private schools received bomb threats via email, prompting immediate responses from bomb disposal squads and police. Following similar threats in Delhi, authorities initiated thorough checks and precautionary evacuations to ensure the safety of students and staff.

title: 'Would you like to hear lies?' Lalu's 'electoral force' jibe at PM Modi's Bihar visit
content: Ahead of PM Modi's Bihar visit, RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav mocked his arrival, attributing it to "electoral force." Tejashwi Yadav satirized Modi's itinerary, highlighting alleged hypocrisy. The visit, focused on launching development projects worth ₹7,200 crore, occurs amid crime concerns.

title: RIL share price: Ambani-led co adds $40bn in m-cap; best rally over Nifty50 in 5 yrs
content: Reliance Industries' shares are experiencing a significant rally this year, outperforming the Nifty50 and adding $40 billion to its market capitalization. Analysts predict continued growth driven by improved refining margins and strong performance in telecommunications and retail.

title: 'Affair or just shy?': Chris Martin puts Astronomer CEO & his HR in awkward spot - Watch
content: Astronomer's CEO, Andy Byron, and Chief People Officer, Kristin Cabot, are embroiled in controversy after a viral "kiss cam" moment at a Coldplay concert fueled affair allegations. The incident triggered a social media firestorm, prompting scrutiny of the company's culture and leadership. Amidst silence from Astronomer, former employees have criticized Byron's leadership, further escalating the reputational crisis.

title: What is the best time to eat nuts for gut health - read here
content: According to Dr. Saurabh Sethi, incorporating specific nuts at optimal times can significantly boost health. Almonds in the morning enhance metabolic health and mental clarity, while mid-morning pine nuts aid in appetite control. Cashews at lunchtime boost immunity and energy. Pistachios in the afternoon prevent energy slumps, and evening walnuts promote better sleep.

title: Patna-Delhi Amrit Bharat: PM Modi to launch new Bihar route today; check details
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate four new Amrit Bharat Express trains in Bihar, significantly boosting rail infrastructure and regional connectivity. The launch, part of a larger development project worth over Rs 7,200 crore, aims to provide affordable and comfortable travel, especially in eastern India.

title: The 'Late' Show: End of an era as CBS cancels Stephen Colbert's popular show
content: CBS will discontinue 'The Late Show with Stephen Colbert' by May 2026, citing financial challenges despite its high ratings. This decision follows a legal settlement between Paramount and Donald Trump, fueling speculation about political motivations behind the cancellation, especially given Colbert's criticism of Trump. Colbert acknowledged the show's end, expressing gratitude to CBS and his audience.

title: Jon Rahm snaps at fan as pressure mounts at Open's toughest stage
content: At the Open Championship, Jon Rahm faced a tense moment. A spectator's whistle disturbed his shot on the 11th hole. Rahm expressed his frustration openly. He later acknowledged his overreaction. Despite the incident and subsequent bogeys, Rahm recovered. He finished the round at one-under-par. The incident highlights the mental challenges of professional golf.

title: Maharashtra family ties up 80-year-old in car, goes to see Taj Mahal
content: An 80-year-old man was discovered tied to a car seat near the Taj Mahal in Agra, left alone by his family from Maharashtra who were sightseeing. Parking staff found him in critical condition due to the heat and humidity, prompting a rescue. Police were alerted, and a medical team advised immediate hospitalization.

title: 'Zero tolerance for terror': India hails US move on Lashkar proxy TRF; EAM calls it strong coordination
content: In a significant diplomatic achievement for India, the United States has designated The Resistance Front (TRF), a proxy of Pakistan-backed Lashkar-e-Tayyiba (LeT), as a Foreign Terrorist Organization (FTO) and a Specially Designated Global Terrorist (SDGT). External affairs minister S Jaishankar welcomed the move, calling it a "strong affirmation" of counterterrorism cooperation.

title: Mumbai chawl collapse: Floors cave in at 3-storey building; many feared trapped
content: A house collapse in Mumbai's Bharat Nagar, Bandra East, injured at least 11 people early this morning. The incident occurred at Chawl No. 37 near the Bandra Kurla Complex, trapping several individuals under the debris.

title: IND vs ENG: 'An incredible fight' - Gambhir hails Jadeja's heroics after Lord's thriller
content: Despite India's narrow defeat in the Lord's Test, head coach Gautam Gambhir lauded Ravindra Jadeja's resilient performance. Chasing 193, Jadeja's unbeaten 61 nearly secured a miraculous victory. His grit under pressure drew praise from captain Shubman Gill and teammates, highlighting his valuable all-round skills.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the gold rate outlook for today
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices exhibit resilience around key support levels, currently trading near ₹97,480. A cautiously optimistic tone prevails, bolstered by a bounce from critical moving averages. Technical indicators suggest stabilization, favoring a buy-on-dip strategy near ₹97,350 with a stop-loss at ₹96,800, targeting ₹97,800 and ₹98,200 if global sentiment remains supportive, says Jateen Trivedi, VP Research Analyst - Commodity and Currency, LKP Securities:

title: An evening with Farokh Engineer: BBQ, Tendulkar's Old Trafford ton and the wait for Gavaskar
content: Farokh Engineer, in Manchester, enjoyed watching a club cricket match with Dilip Vengsarkar and friends, reminiscing about his cricketing days. He fondly recalled hosting a barbecue for the Indian team in 1990, where a young Sachin Tendulkar was present before his first century. In an exclusive chat with TimesofIndia.com, he spoke about how times have changed in cricket culture.

title: Shannon Sharpe accuser’s lawyer skips court, cites secret delay deal
content: The Shannon Sharpe sexual assault case saw a twist. The accuser's legal team missed a court date in Las Vegas. Attorney Tony Buzbee cited a mutual agreement for postponement. Judge Albertson expressed disappointment. Sharpe's attorney sought an extension. The next hearing is in September. Sharpe denies the charges. He calls it blackmail. The case involves public accusations and counter-accusations.

title: Report: Warriors eye $86.6M Magic star in bold three‑team trade
content: The Golden State Warriors are reportedly eyeing a trade for defensive standout Jonathan Isaac, alongside Jett Howard and Mo Gueye, in a three-team deal involving the Orlando Magic and Atlanta Hawks. This move aims to bolster the Warriors' defense and add size. Orlando would receive Moses Moody and Gui Santos, while Atlanta gains Goga Bitadze and a 2027 first-round pick.

title: NHL trade twist: Canucks, Leafs battle off ice for prized free agent
content: Vancouver Canucks are actively pursuing Jack Roslovic, a top free agent. This comes after a recent trade with Toronto Maple Leafs. Canucks aim to strengthen their team for a playoff push. Toronto also seeks to fill the gap left by Mitch Marner. They are considering Yegor Chinakhov. Canucks are exploring trade options if free agency doesn't work.

title: Bomb scare: 20 Delhi schools receive threat emails; search under way
content: Two schools in New Delhi, Abhinav Public School in Rohini Sector 3 and Richmondd Global School in Paschim Vihar, were targeted with bomb threats on Friday, prompting immediate responses from authorities.

title: IND vs ENG: 'You win by ...' - Rahane urges India to change XI for Manchester Test
content: Ajinkya Rahane urges India to prioritise taking 20 wickets for Test victories, highlighting the team's batting-heavy strategy's shortcomings after a narrow loss at Lord's. He emphasised the importance of bolstering the bowling attack for the crucial fourth Test in Manchester. Rahane also lauded Ben Stokes' pivotal fielding effort, identifying it as a turning point in the game.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 goes below 25,000; BSE Sensex down over 500 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 went below 25,000, BSE Sensex was down over 500 points.

title: IND vs ENG: Are Jasprit Bumrah, Rishabh Pant fit for 4th Test? Injury concerns in squad
content: India face crucial decisions regarding Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant's fitness for the pivotal fourth Test against England, with the series at 2-1 in favour of the hosts. At the optional practice session, assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate provided an update on their fitness while also revealing another injury in the camp.

title: Siddaramaiah slap gesture row: Cop who sought VRS posted as Belagavi DCP
content: Narayan Baramani, the police officer involved in a controversial incident with Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, has been appointed as DCP of Belagavi city. Baramani had sought voluntary retirement following the alleged 'slap gesture' during a Congress rally. He later withdrew his request after discussions with the CM and Home Minister.

title: Trump threatens to sue WSJ over 'birthday' note to Epstein; what did the letter say?
content: A birthday album made for Jeffrey Epstein's 50th birthday, featuring a controversial letter purportedly signed by Donald Trump, has resurfaced. The letter includes a suggestive drawing and text, which Trump vehemently denies creating, threatening a lawsuit against The Wall Street Journal. US vice president JD Vance has criticized the report.

title: IND vs ENG: Drop Crisis! India's catching woes undermine Test campaign in England
content: India's Test team is struggling in England, trailing 1-2 due to poor fielding. Dropped catches have been extremely costly, with a catching efficiency of just 60.90% compared to England's 78.30%. Missed opportunities in key moments have allowed England's batsmen to score crucial runs. Improving catching is essential for India to win the remaining Tests and salvage the series.

title: 'No trip scheduled': White House denies Trump's Pakistan trip; local media retracts report
content: The White House has refuted reports of a planned visit by President Trump to Pakistan in September. Trump is scheduled to visit Scotland from July 25-29, meeting with Prime Minister Starmer to advance trade discussions.

title: Chhattisgarh: ED raids former CM Bhupesh Baghel's Bhilai home
content: Enforcement Directorate officials conducted a search at the Bhilai residence of former Chief Minister and senior Congress leader Bhupesh Baghel on Friday morning. The ED team, accompanied by CRPF personnel, arrived in three cars. Baghel's office, through his X handle, alleged the action was intended to suppress the raising of the Tamnar tree cutting issue.

title: GSEB SSC supplementary result 2025 declared: Check direct link here
content: The Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSEB) announced the Class 10 (SSC) Supplementary Exam Result 2025 on July 18. Students who appeared for the exams between June 23 and July 1 can now check their results on gseb.org, via WhatsApp, or SMS using their 6-digit seat number. Passing students can proceed to Class 11 admissions.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for July 18; check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook for the Nifty and Bank Nifty, anticipating potential uptrends with key support levels identified. UPL and Varun Beverages are highlighted as top stock picks, with buy ranges specified based on technical analysis indicating potential breakouts and upward movement in the coming months.

title: Football: Palmer reveals what Trump told him on stage after FIFA CWC win
content: Chelsea's Cole Palmer revealed that US President Donald Trump told him his son is a huge fan during the FIFA Club World Cup final trophy presentation. Palmer received the tournament's best player award from Trump after Chelsea's 3-0 victory over Paris Saint-Germain.

title: 'You've got to thread it': Why hole No. 1 is playing a big part in this year's Open Championship
content: Playing the first hole at Royal Portrush well or poorly could determine who hoists the Claret Jug on Sunday.

title: Howell resigns as executive director of NFLPA
content: Lloyd Howell Jr. resigned as executive director of the NFL Players Association, citing distractions his leadership has caused in recent weeks.

title: Sources: Lillard reaches deal to return to Blazers
content: Nine-time NBA All-Star Damian Lillard agreed to a three-year, $42 million contract to return to the Trail Blazers, sources told ESPN on Thursday.

title: Sources: Steelers make Watt highest-paid non-QB
content: T.J. Watt and the Steelers have agreed to a three-year, $123 million extension that again makes him the highest-paid non-quarterback in NFL history.

title: McIlroy rebounds at Portrush, in mix following 70
content: Six years after recording a quadruple-bogey 8 on No. 1 at Royal Portrush, Rory McIlroy carded a bogey-5 en route to a 1-under 70 that left him right in the mix at the Open. "I didn't feel like I was walking into the unknown this time around," he said.

title: Turnout high, but WNBA CBA talks stall in Indy
content: The first in-person meeting between the league and union since December lasted for a couple of hours and ended with no resolution on the CBA.

title: Chargers WR Williams retires, ends 8-year career
content: Chargers wide receiver Mike Williams is retiring from the NFL after eight seasons, with a source saying the decision surprised the team.

title: Trump mulls EO on athletes' employment status
content: President Donald Trump is considering an executive order that would require federal authorities to clarify whether college athletes can be considered employees of their schools.

title: Stratospheric skydiver Baumgartner dies in crash
content: Extreme athlete Felix Baumgartner, the first skydiver to fall faster than the speed of sound, in a leap through the stratosphere, has died in a paraglider crash. He was 56.

title: 💗 Klay, Megan Thee Stallion on the red carpet
content: The NBA star and Grammy Award-winning rapper made their red carpet debut at her inaugural Pete & Thomas Foundation Gala.

title: Grading 30-plus NBA deals, including Damian Lillard's Portland reunion
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Blazers bringing back franchise icon Damian Lillard.

title: 'We couldn't chance it': Why the Suns and Bradley Beal finally came to terms
content: One element of the Suns' roster failure has loomed: How to end their marriage to the three-time All-Star.

title: WNBA players, coaches voice frustration over how games are called
content: Players, coaches and fans say they want greater consistency regarding how games are refereed and the level of physicality allowed.

title: Hannah Hampton is the difference in bizarre shootout, but England needed super-subs
content: England started badly vs. Sweden, turned things around in 103 second-half seconds, then won a penalty shootout which saw nine misses to progress to the Euro 2025 semifinals. But they have their goalkeeper and two super-subs to thank.

title: The top 10 cornerbacks ahead of 2025 NFL season: Who is ranked after Pat Surtain II?
content: Who are the best cornerbacks in the NFL? We asked execs, coaches and scouts from around the league to rank their top 10.

title: 14 players who could be picked No. 1 in the 2026 NFL draft
content: Which quarterback could go first overall? What about edge rusher T.J. Parker or another non-QB? Let's project the race.

title: How Bo Jackson on a bicycle united Alabama after a record-breaking storm
content: The GOAT created a bike ride to help tornado-damaged Alabama. No one knew what it'd do -- or how it'd end.

title: Ranking the top 25 college football recruits regardless of class
content: Why let rising seniors get all the glory? We break down the best prospects in the country, including underclassmen.

title: The 10 MLB trends that ruled the first half -- and whether they'll continue
content: From chaos in the AL East to emerging young sluggers, we break down the season's biggest themes and what we should expect down the stretch run.

title: Updated top 10 prospect rankings for all 30 MLB teams -- with 2025 draft picks included!
content: Who is rising and falling in every major league farm system after the MLB draft? Kiley McDaniel digs in.

title: 'Sad.' 'Embarrassing.' Why players were a no-show at the MLB draft
content: Moving the draft to All-Star week was supposed to give it some sizzle. But not one player was in attendance.

title: Shohei Ohtani announces children's book: 'Decoy Saves Opening Day'
content: The Los Angeles Dodgers star co-authored the 32-page book with Michael Blank and it is set to release next February.

title: Weah to Marseille, Reyna to anywhere but Dortmund? Best transfer fits for USMNT stars
content: The World Cup is just one year away, so what moves, if any, should these eight USMNT players make to ensure they'll be in top form next summer?

title: Sources: Man Utd increase Mbeumo bid to $94M
content: Manchester United have increased their bid for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo, sources have told ESPN.

title: Marta 'saddened' by conditions at Copa América
content: Brazilian players, including six-time FIFA Player of the Year Marta, have criticised CONMEBOL and the organisers of the Women's Copa América in Ecuador for requiring teams to warm up in confined indoor areas rather than on the pitch.

title: Sources: Thiago to return to Flick's Barça staff
content: Barcelona expect to close a deal for Thiago Alcantara to return to the club as part of coach Hansi Flick's staff in the coming weeks, various sources have told ESPN.

title: Wiegman 'very emotional' after 'crazy' England win
content: Sarina Wiegman said she thought at least three times that England's Euro 2025 journey was over before they defeated Sweden on penalties.

title: Pepi 'very close' to return, embracing No. 9 jersey
content: PSV Eindhoven and USMNT striker Ricardo Pepi revealed he's "very close" to a return to the pitch after suffering a knee injury in January.

title: Madrid address stadium noise, want concerts back
content: Real Madrid are hopeful of resuming hosting concerts at the Santiago Bernabeu as work concludes on the revamped stadium this year, the club has said, as it posted a record €1.185 billion in income.

title: Argentina to allow away fans after 12-year ban
content: Argentine football clubs can now welcome away supporters after a 12-year ban, the Argentine Football Association said on Thursday.

title: How Spain's quiet superstar, Mariona Caldentey, stepped out of the shadows
content: For much of Mariona Caldentey's career she operated in the shadows, but the decision to swap Barcelona for Arsenal has thrust her into the spotlight.

title: Bradley: What it's like boxing Pacquiao, and how he can beat Barrios
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. shares his thoughts about fighting Manny Pacquiao and breaks down Saturday's fight.

title: How to approach potential Rashee Rice suspension
content: Rashee Rice is likely to face a lengthy suspension in 2025, here's what fantasy managers should do right now to prepare.

title: From Chase to London, ranking the most reliable TD scorers among WRs
content: A deep dive into the most trustworthy TD scorers among wideouts based on target data, efficiency and more.

title: Ranking MLS' 2025 third kits: Who hits, misses on retro vibes?
content: Eleven teams in MLS have third kits in 2025, and ESPN ranks each throwback-inspired shirt from worst to first.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to move for Villa's Rogers
content: Chelsea have made Aston Villa winger Morgan Rogers their top priority this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Should we have been surprised? A look back at the season's first-half predictions
content: How good is our crystal ball? Before the season's second half gets underway, let's see how our first-half predictions panned out.

title: Waiver wire: Start the second half strong with these pickups
content: As the season's second half gets ready to begin, here are the players you should claim off the waiver wire.

title: Manipur's Haofa Dog Breed Now In Assam Rifles Unit
content: Haofa is an indigenous dog breed from the Manipur, valued for its sharp hunting instincts and loyalty. Two types of Haofa are commonly recognised: a smaller breed, and a larger one with a short bluish-black coat, long muzzle, and broad jaws.

title: "You Deserve To Suffer": 60 Schools In Delhi, Bengaluru Receive Bomb Threats
content: While in Delhi, 20 schools got 'hoax' bomb threats via email, 40 schools in Bengaluru were sent a similar message.

title: Odisha College Horror Victim's Friend Reveals Months Of Abuse, Harassment
content: The 22-year-old student in Odisha who set herself on fire, alleging sexual harassment by her college professor, had confided in her friends about what she was going through months before her death.

title: Opinion: Blog | From A Goldman Sachs Job To OnlyFans, The Lure Of The 'Creator Economy'
content: The rise of the creator economy has subtly brutalised the psyche of the toppers, the achievers, the ones who did everything right. Their skills and knowledge are barely valued in a world where content outperforms competence.

title: Who Is Kristin Cabot, Spotted With Astronomer CEO Andy Byron At Coldplay Concert
content: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron was caught on camera in what appeared to be an intimate position with the company's Chief Public Officer at the Coldplay concert in Boston on Wednesday.

title: "Ask Centre": Supreme Court On Nimisha Priya Case Negotiators' Yemen Travel
content: The Supreme Court has asked a private organisation, which is making efforts for the safe release of Kerala nurse Nimisha Priya, to approach the Centre to seek permission to travel to the Middle Eastern country for negotiations to stall her execution.

title: 700 Bullets A Minute, 800 Metres Range: The Amethi-Made AK-203 Rifle
content: A joint venture company has been established for the indigenous production of AK-203, named 'Sher' in India, in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi.

title: Mumbai Man Locked Inside Car By Family, Rescued Near Taj Mahal
content: An elderly man was found bound with a piece of cloth inside a locked car, seemingly abandoned by his family on Thursday at the Western Gate parking of the Taj Mahal, police said.

title: Supreme Court Setback For Lalu Yadav Ahead Of Bihar Elections
content: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to stay trial court proceedings against former Bihar chief minister and RJD supremo Lalu Yadav in the CBI's land-for-jobs case.

title: "Bagheera, Friends On Night Walk": Black Panther, Leopards Stroll On Tamil Nadu Road
content: Two spotted leopards are seen wandering beside the melanistic leopard, who is noticeably darker. It is very unusual for melanistic and non-melanistic species to wander in such unison.

title: "Important Step": India On US' Big Move Against Group Behind Pahalgam Attack
content: India on Friday welcomed the US's move to designate The Resistance Front (TRF), the group behind the Pahalgam terror attack, as a terrorist organisation and described the move as "a strong affirmation of India-US counter-terrorism operation".

title: Astronomer CEO's Wife Drops Surname After Affair Caught At Coldplay Concert
content: Megan Kerrigan, the wife of Astronomer CEO Andy Byron, has dropped her surname from her Facebook profile after a video in which her husband appeared to get intimate with his company's Chief Public Officer, Kristen Cabot, at a Coldplay concert went vi

title: Tauseef Badshah: Story Of Bihar Hospital Killer With Movie-Style Swagger
content: In one of the most chilling displays of targeted violence in recent memory in Bihar, CCTV footage from inside Patna's upscale Paras Hospital captured five men entering a corridor in silence.

title: Audacious Walk, Then A Gun Wave: 5 Men Who Killed Gangster In Bihar Hospital
content: The incident took place on Thursday when the five men casually walked into the gangster's room in the Paras Hospital in Patna, pumped bullets into him, and left.

title: What Is The Resistance Front, Tagged By US As Terror Group After Pahalgam Attack
content: The US on Friday designated The Resistance Front (TRF), the group behind the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 tourists on April 22, as a terrorist organisation.

title: UP Man Kills Stepmother Over Property Dispute, Arrested
content: A 50-year-old woman was allegedly hacked to death by her stepson over a property dispute at Nayagaon village here, a police official said on Friday.

title: Friend Spikes Man's Food At Delhi Hotel, Steals Rs 13 Lakh Worth Jewellery
content: Gold jewellery weighing over 1,340 grams has been stolen from a man, whose food was spiked by a friend he was staying with at a hotel in central Delhi's Paharganj area, a police officer said on Thursday.

title: Temple Can't Deny Entry Based On Caste: Madras High Court
content: In a significant ruling affirming the principle of equality, the Madras High Court has directed the Ariyalur Superintendent of Police (SP) to ensure that Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals are not denied entry into the Puthukudu Ayyanar Temple.

title: PM Modi Extends Birthday Greetings To Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended warm birthday greetings to Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Friday, praising his efforts in enhancing India's progress in key sectors.

title: 'Vivacious Varenya': The 10-Year-Old Assam Girl Who Has Over 20 Lakh Followers
content: Varenya Borbora, popularly known online as Vivacious Varenya, is a social media personality and content creator from Jorhat.

title: Top Georgia high school hoopers since 2000 : Who earned the crown?
content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of Georgia based on high school career achievements.

title: Where do Taylor and Serrano land after all-women card?
content: Lots of movement after a boxing card with 17 titles on the line. Here's the latest women's pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Steve Caballero on how Tony Hawk's Pro-Skater pushed skateboarding to innovate
content: Steve Caballero has been skating since he was 12, and he's been thrilled to see the scene grow alongside Tony Hawk's Pro Skater.

title: Mamata Banerjee only concerned about Bengali-speaking Muslims: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: CM Himanta Biswa Sarma cautioned Mamata Banerjee that if she comes to Assam for the sake of Muslim-Bengalis, Assamese and Hindu-Bengalis will "not spare her"

title: Police initiate probe into 'recruitment irregularities' in Meghalaya
content: The investigation was initiated following an internal scrutiny and official correspondence with the Staff Selection Commission (SSC) and the CGCA, they said.

title: Nimisha Priya execution: Supreme Court asks Centre to consider merits of group working to save nurse for travel to Yemen
content: Attorney-General  R. Venkataramani expressed the government’s concern to bring Nimisha Priya back home safely. “All the government can do is being done,” he said

title: Three elephants run over by train in West Bengal’s Jhargram
content: The incident occurred when an elephant herd that from Jharkhand’s Dalma forest was traversing on the Banstala railway line track in West Bengal's Paschim Midnapore district.

title: Kerala University V-C Mohanan Kunnummal returns amid tight security; SFI refrains from protesting on campus
content: Kunnummal had stayed away from the university citing threats to his life and peace on the campus following intense protests by SFI

title: Vidhan Bhavan clash: People with criminal background being inducted into BJP, says Sanjay Raut
content: Sanjay Raut said Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis should dissolve his government and the President's rule must be imposed in the State

title: Kavinder Gupta takes oath as new Ladakh Lieutenant Governor
content: Kavinder Gupta was administered the oath of office by the Chief Justice of the Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh High Court, Justice Arun Palli, at a ceremony held at Ladakh Raj Niwas in Leh

title: Two militants arrested in Manipur for extortion activities
content: The moves follows the search operations  being conducted by security forces across Manipur since ethnic violence erupted two years ago.

title: Panic in Bengaluru as 15 private schools receive bomb threat emails
content: Email copies reviewed by The Hindu show the messages were sent at 7:31 am. from the ID roadkill333@atomicmail.io

title: Five Indian bars have made it to Asia’s 50 Best Bars 2025. Is Indian mixology on the rise?
content: We speak to the bartenders in Bengaluru, Goa and Delhi, to find out why Lair, Soka, Boilermaker, ZLB 23 and Bar Spirit Forward stand out

title: In midnight drama, police drag aside NCP(SP) MLA protesting detention of supporter
content: Jitendra Awhad launched an aggressive sit-in protest near the rear gate of the Vidhan Bhavan premises around 2 a.m. after police began taking away his supporter Nitin Deshmukh

title: Rahul Gandhi extends support to his brother-in-law Robert Vadra amid ED chargesheet
content: I stand with Robert, Priyanka and their children as they face yet another onslaught of malicious, politically motivated slander and harassment, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi.

title: Kerala child rights commission flags negligence on part of Thevalakkara school, KSEB in student’s electrocution
content: Kerala State Commission for Protection of Child Rights chairperson says authorities glossed over danger posed by low-tension power line that sagged dangerously close to awning of school building

title: Why are Ola, Uber, Rapido drivers’ striking work in Mumbai?
content: Cab services in Mumbai have remained disrupted for a third consecutive day as Ola and Uber drivers continue their indefinite strike, demanding higher per-kilometre fares, reduced commission charges, and immediate government intervention.

title: India non-committal on revival of Russia-India-China framework
content: Official sources said no meeting of the RIC format has been agreed to at this point in time and there are no discussions underway on its scheduling

title: Unidentified persons hurl petrol bombs at vehicles of private school after student’s death in Tirunelveli
content: The police said a Class X student from Maanaabharananallur was reportedly censured by his teachers for “behaving in an unruly manner” and “not studying well” on July 4. Upset over this, he attempted suicide on July 7 on the school premises and died on Thursday

title: Justice Yashwant Varma moves Supreme Court against panel report
content: The inquiry panel had said “strong inferential evidence” established that the burnt currency was removed by Justice Varma’s trusted staff from the storeroom during the early hours of March 15

title: 'What is guarantee Rahul Gandhi won't be jailed before I am', says Himanta
content: Coming to a State and saying whom he will send to jail or not is unbefitting of a national leader... It proves how important I am, says Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: India welcomes U.S. listing of The Resistance Front as global terrorist outfit
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar described Washington's decision on The Resistance Force (TRF) as a "strong affirmation" of India-U.S. counter-terrorism cooperation

title: One dead, 3 injured as school building’s roof collapses in Ranchi
content: Operation is underway to rescue three persons trapped under the debris at the school in Piska More area in Ranchi

title: What does the August 2025 U.S. Visa Bulletin mean for Indian applicants?
content: The August 2025 U.S. Visa Bulletin presents key updates for Indian applicants, with advancements in the EB-5 and EB-3 categories and no movement in family-based visas.

title: A military expedition to the Gangetic  plains that inspired a Chola capital
content: During the expedition, Rajendra Chola I defeated several kings and chieftains. The king celebrated the victory by assuming the title ‘Gangaikonda Cholan’. He also built Gangaikonda  Cholapuram in the present-day Ariyalur district, along with the Gangaikonda Cholisvaram, the Shiva temple that was the jewel in his crown

title: The copper chronicles that detail the reign and deeds of Rajendra Chola I
content: Among the most valuable records from Rajendra’s time are four sets of copper plate inscriptions discovered at different locations. The Tiruvalangadu Copper Plates, the Karanthai Copper Plates, the Tirukkalar Copper Plates, and the Esalam Copper Plates highlight the Chola lineage, temple endowments, and military expeditions

title: Chola Gangam: A symbol of victory lies in ruins
content: Near Brihadisvara Temple lies Chola Gangam, a tank spread over 17 km. It had once occupied 16 miles. Prime Minister Narendra  Modi’s proposed visit on July 27 and the plan to release a commemorative coin will likely spotlight the condition of the tank

title: Three-storey building collapses in Bandra east; seven injured
content: Teams from Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB Level-II), BMC, Police, MHADA, PWD, Adani, and other civic agencies have been mobilised

title: Over 5 lakh applications received so far for 35,726 teacher posts in Bengal schools: WBSSC
content: Notification for fresh recruitment was issued on May 30 in adherence to a directive by the Supreme Court

title: For every child free for adoption in India, 13 parents wait in line: Data
content: The average delay for prospective parents to get an adoption referral in India has increased to over three years

title: Budameru floods: a trauma that refuses to subside
content: In August 2024, Budameru floods wreaked havoc on Vijayawada, submerging homes and taking lives. A year into the disaster, residents continue to grapple with loss and a lingering dread for another deluge. Nellore Sravani speaks to the people who are limping back to normalcy and finds out the status of an ambitious project aimed at ending the generational trauma

title: Fresh batch of over 7,900 pilgrims leaves Jammu for Amarnath after one-day suspension
content: With this, a total of 1,09,461 pilgrims have departed from the Jammu base camp for the Valley since July 2, when Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha flagged off the first batch

title: Bringing a ‘ghost river’ back to life
content: The Karnataka government has announced its ambitious plan to bring the Arkavati back to life, but people living close to the river have little hope, while experts point out to many challenges, writes K.C. Deepika.

title: Piracy, the unwritten villain of Telugu films
content: Before the first weekend of a new theatrical release ends, entire films are pirated and posted online, leaving Telugu cinema wide open to digital loot. With losses estimated at ₹3,700 crore in 2024, the industry is shifting from damage control to decisive action through police arrests, court orders and digital tracking. From cam prints to crypto deals, the network is organised, but with enforcement intensifying, there is hope that the plot is slowly but surely turning. A report by Sangeetha Devi Dundoo

title: India will leverage AI to lead global creative economy: I&B Secretary Sanjay Jaju
content: India’s leading AI startups were urged to develop indigenous, scalable solutions that reflect the linguistic and cultural diversity of the nation

title: CPI(M)’s Md Salim says SIR Electoral Roll revision will target marginalised people and strip democratic rights
content: “This attack on Bengalis across the country is an attack on the diversity, democracy, and unity of our country,” Mr Salim

title: Raziyya Sultan, Nur Jehan dropped from new Class 8 NCERT history textbook
content: References to Tipu Sultan, Haidar Ali, four Anglo-Mysore wars removed, while sections related to Anglo-Maratha wars retained

title: CARA asks State adoption agencies to strengthen counselling process
content: This initiative aims to reinforce the psychosocial support framework for all key stakeholders — prospective adoptive parents, adopted children, and biological parents who surrender their child for adoption

title: Task force wants Andhra Pradesh to take a cue from States like Tamil Nadu to tap potential of blue economy
content: It has also suggested to the government to develop a hi-tech city along the proposed ring road around Amaravati, covering AI, semiconductors and other industrial hubs

title: West Bengal finally asks its colleges to follow HC order by shutting down students’ union rooms
content: West Bengal colleges ordered to lock students’ union rooms following Calcutta High Court directive for campus safety

title: Operation Sindoor delivered a strong message on security: Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah said, the vision of a prosperous and secure nation had been turned into a reality under the present dispensation

title: Odisha college girl death: Flames of protest singe the system
content: After a 20-year-old student set herself ablaze on a college campus in Odisha due to alleged denial of justice in a sexual harassment complaint filed against her teacher, the State machinery swung into action. The President visited the hospital when the woman was on ventilator, students protested, and top doctors paid close attention to her. Satyasundar Barik reports on her death, her family’s shock, and the political panic that followed

title: Form SIT to probe tax scam in Madurai Corporation: High Court
content: The judges direct the Inspector-General of Police (South Zone) and the Madurai Commissioner of Police to constitute the team, headed by a senior IPS officer with proven integrity

title: U.P. DGP says 238 criminals have been killed and 9,467 shot in leg in 14,973 encounters since 2017
content: The force has ensured an “aggressive crackdown on crime” under the Chief Minister’s directions, the DGP added.

title: HC tells W.B. to file affidavit on resuming student union polls
content: Student union elections came to a halt across higher education institutions a little before the Covid-19 pandemic in 2020

title: Dharmasthala burials case: Former SC Judge demands SIT probe monitored by a sitting or retired judge of HC or SC
content: Police are allegedly coercing him to mark the places he has buried the bodies on a white paper. Also, the statement of the whistleblower is being leaked to private individuals: V. Gopala Gowda

title: A day after Gopalganj clashes, India reiterates call for Bangladesh election ‘with everybody in its fold’
content: The clashes in Gopalganj occurred after NCP leaders arrived outside the memorial of Sheikh Mujib, which is guarded by Awami League activists

title: The parameters of ‘success’ in Bihar’s poll roll revision
content: It remains to be seen whether the Election Commission of India is able to ensure a fair exercise of verification in Bihar

title: India warns against ‘double standards’ over Russian oil
content: The Ministry of External Affairs responds to U.S. Congress Bill mandating 500% duties on countries buying Russian oil; NATO chief threatens India, China, Brazil, top buyers of Russian products, but EU also buys Russian oil

title: Thalassemia patients call for standardised tests to reduce transfusion-transmitted infections
content: At present, Nucleic Acid Testing (NAT), a highly sensitive molecular technique used to screen blood donations for infectious diseases, is used in some hospitals

title: POSH Act application to be extended to TV serial sector soon: WCD Director
content: Attention will also be given to applicability of POSH Act in the gig sector, she says at seminar on strengthening institutional mechanisms combating violence against women and girls

title: I&B Secretary urges AI startups to shape solutions for bridging linguistic divides
content: Invites them to participate in Kalaa Setu, Bhasha Setu challenges on WaveX Startup Accelerator Platform

title: Vijayawada receives top award for cleanliness despite 2024 floods
content: To qualify for the ‘Super Swachh League’ award, a city must rank in the top three positions at least once in the last three years and must stay in the top 20 positions till 2024, says Vijayawada Municipal Corporation Commissioner

title: Bombay High Court upholds constitutional validity of UAPA, rejects sedition challenge
content: Anil Baburao Baile’s petition questioned the constitutional validity of UAPA and sedition law provisions; court found no merit in the arguments raised by the Elgaar Parishad case accused

title: Congress to organise protest at Parliament demanding Statehood for Jammu and Kashmir
content: The Jammu and Kashmir unit of the party said the message would next be taken via the ‘Chalo Delhi Chalo’ campaign on July 21

title: CBFC assures Bombay High Court of decision on certification for film on Yogi Adityanath in two working days
content: Scheduled for theatrical release on August 1, the film ‘Ajey: The Untold Story of a Yogi’ draws inspiration from the book ‘The Monk Who Became Chief Minister’ and is said to depict the life of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath

title: Plea in Supreme Court says Bhopal gas victims have been ‘misclassified’
content: The plea claims that survivors with lasting, severe injuries and illnesses have been wrongly classified under ‘temporary disablement’ and ‘minor injury’ and under-compensated for years

title: Commuters flag lack of transparency in auto, cab fares on aggregator apps
content: Commuters argue that aggregator apps charge significantly higher than the meter fare, often due to vague policies like ‘tips’, ‘congestion fee’, ‘platform fees’, ‘driver addition’ etc

title: Indian Navy’s eastern fleet ships reach Singapore to bolster naval ties in Southeast Asia
content: Indian Navy and Republic of Singapore Navy share operational relations spanning over three decades of cooperation

title: Free CET, NEET, JEE online coaching will be extended to all government, aided PU colleges in Karnataka: Madhu Bangarappa
content: All students who enroll for online training will be given separate login IDs to participate in the classes

title: How Gavin McKenna's Penn State commitment shifted the NHL prospect landscape
content: Gavin McKenna is a young offensive star for the NHL to market . he amassed 129 points in 56 games with the Medicine Hat Tigers last season . the 17-year-old phenom could have remained in the CHL for another year .

title: Joel Embiid sees you
content: Kendrick Perkins: Embiid feels pressured to play through injury showcases trust issues . he says he's leaning back on a couch that seemed spacious until he eased his long body onto it . his son, Arthur, peeks around corners from the hallway to see what we're up to .

title: Why Arsenal broke the women's transfer record to sign Smith from Liverpool
content: the 20-year-old is the first woman to break the £1 million barrier . she surpasses the previous record set by Chelsea's £900,000 ($1.1 million) transfer of defender Naomi Girma . the gunners have added another player to their ranks since winning the UEFA Women's Champions League in may .

title: Full list of every ESPYS 2025 Award winner
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One celebrates the greatest athletes and moments in sports . the show is underway on ABC and ESPN+ . find out who won here . click here for all the latest capital one news .

title: Evolution of WNBA All-Star Game uniforms
content: the 2025 WNBA All-Star Game reaches its 26-year milestone this weekend . caitlin Clark and Napheesa Collier are team captains after finishing as the top two fan vote-getters . each of them drafted their respective team on July 8 setting the stage for a matchup .

title: Fresh threads alert: NFL uniforms get an offseason glow up
content: the new "Charger Power" uniforms will be unveiled in the 2025 offseason . the new uniforms are a popular choice for the Chargers and the los Angeles chargers . they will return their jerseys and pants to their style before they changed their name .

title: The Next Episode: Snoop invests in Swansea City
content: the former premier league club didn't disclose financial details in the announcement . the rapper and entertainment icon helped launch the team's 2025-26 home shirt last weekend . he also took a playful jab at owner Ryan Reynolds during the launch .

title: Sights and sounds from the first round of the Open Championship
content: the 153rd Open Championship has started at royal portrush golf course in northern Ireland . Xander Schauffele looks to defend his 2024 championship, but it'sn't the source of fulfillment in his life . the crowd enjoyed a chip-in on the 3rd for birdie .

title: The 20 most interesting storylines at NFL training camps
content: christmas is in December, is four weeks long and comes with a present nearly every single day . it's just around the corner, with veteran players for the Chargers and Lions reporting to camp . there's little I look forward to more than the first video to hit my timeline .

title: Power Rankings heading into Week 8: Outlaws lead the way
content: the outlaws face the Whipsnakes on saturday night . a goal from jared Bernhardt is the goalkeeper for the Outlaws . the team will be in action for Indigenous Weekend on friday and Saturday .

title: Is fighting at home in New Orleans an advantage for Dustin Poirier at UFC 318?
content: Dustin Poirier chose Max Holloway to be his final opponent . he was a lightweight, his natural weight class, after cutting an extra 10 pounds to featherweight . poirier derived his most palpable jubilation that night from what he said to him immediately after the fight .
